description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物、作家、史学家和探险家，曾任第26任美国总统，被认为是美国历史上最伟大的总统之一。
description.en: American politician, writer, historian, and explorer who served as the 26th president of the United States, and is considered one of the greatest presidents in American history.

description.zh-cn: 美国第25任总统，在任内被无政府主义者刺杀身亡。
description.en: The 25th President of the United States, who was assassinated in office by an anarchist.

description.zh-cn: 导致时任美国总统威廉·麦金莱死亡的刺杀事件，副总统西奥多·罗斯福因此继任总统。
description.en: The assassination event that led to the death of U.S. President William McKinley, resulting in Vice President Theodore Roosevelt succeeding to the presidency.

description.zh-cn: 刺杀美国总统威廉·麦金莱的无政府主义者。
description.en: The anarchist who assassinated U.S. President William McKinley.

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国的国家元首、政府首脑与三军统帅。
description.en: The head of state, head of government, and commander-in-chief of the armed forces of the United States of America.

en: Vice President of the United States

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国联邦政府中，总统第一继任人。
description.en: The first person in the presidential line of succession in the United States federal government.

description.zh-cn: 1904年至1905年间大日本帝国与俄罗斯帝国为争夺在朝鲜半岛和中国东北地区的影响力而进行的战争。
description.en: A war fought between the Empire of Japan and the Russian Empire from 1904 to 1905 over rival imperial ambitions in Manchuria and Korea.

description.zh-cn: 诺贝尔奖中之一，旨在表彰为促进国际亲善、废除或裁减常备军队以及为和平会议的组织和宣传尽到最大努力或作出最大贡献的人。
description.en: One of the Nobel Prizes, awarded to those who have done the most or the best work for fraternity between nations, for the abolition or reduction of standing armies and for the holding and promotion of peace congresses.

description.zh-cn: 位于中美洲国家巴拿马的穿洋运河，连接太平洋与大西洋。西奥多·罗斯福总统任内是其建设的关键时期。
description.en: A man-made waterway in Panama that connects the Atlantic Ocean with the Pacific Ocean. The presidency of Theodore Roosevelt was a key period for its construction.

description.zh-cn: 美国第27任总统，罗斯福的继任者，后与罗斯福决裂并在1912年总统大选中成为其竞争对手。
description.en: The 27th President of the United States, Roosevelt's successor, who later had a falling out with Roosevelt and became his competitor in the 1912 presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 1912年由西奥多·罗斯福创建的美国第三方政党，旨在支持其竞选总统。
description.en: An American third party created by Theodore Roosevelt in 1912 to support his presidential campaign.

description.zh-cn: 美国第28任总统，在1912年总统选举中因共和党分裂而获胜。
description.en: The 28th President of the United States, who won the 1912 presidential election due to the split in the Republican Party.

nodes.id: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

zh-cn: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 美国第32任总统，西奥多·罗斯福的远房堂弟。
description.en: The 32nd President of the United States and a distant cousin of Theodore Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 美国商人和慈善家，西奥多·罗斯福总统的父亲。
description.en: American businessman and philanthropist, father of President Theodore Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福总统的母亲。
description.en: Mother of President Theodore Roosevelt.

nodes.id: 爱丽丝·哈撒韦·李·罗斯福

zh-cn: 爱丽丝·哈撒韦·李·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福的第一任妻子，在生下女儿爱丽丝后不久去世。
description.en: Theodore Roosevelt's first wife, who died shortly after giving birth to their daughter, Alice.

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福的第二任妻子。
description.en: Theodore Roosevelt's second wife.

description.zh-cn: 美国海军军官及历史学家，其海权理论深刻影响了西奥多·罗斯福。
description.en: American naval officer and historian whose sea power theories strongly influenced Theodore Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 1912年在威斯康星州密尔沃基试图刺杀西奥多·罗斯福的理发店老板。
description.en: A saloonkeeper who attempted to assassinate Theodore Roosevelt in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, in 1912.

description.zh-cn: 一场主要发生在欧洲但波及全世界的世界大战。
description.en: A global war originating in Europe that lasted from 28 July 1914 to 11 November 1918.

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福最小的儿子，在第一次世界大战中作为飞行员阵亡。
description.en: The youngest son of Theodore Roosevelt, who was killed in action as a pilot during World War I.

description.zh-cn: 八国联军战争后，清政府与11国签订《辛丑条约》中的赔款。罗斯福政府后来决定将多余部分退还中国，用于教育事业。
description.en: The indemnity paid by the Qing government to 11 countries under the Boxer Protocol after the Boxer Rebellion. The Roosevelt administration later decided to return the excess portion to China for educational purposes.

description.zh-cn: 中国著名大学，其前身清华留美预备学校的开办资金部分来源于美国退还的庚子赔款。
description.en: A renowned Chinese university whose predecessor, the Tsinghua College, was established with funds from the remitted Boxer Indemnity from the United States.

description.zh-cn: 由西奥多·罗斯福在美西战争期间组建和指挥的部队，俗称“莽骑兵”。
description.en: A unit commanded by Theodore Roosevelt during the Spanish–American War, popularly known as the "Rough Riders".

description.zh-cn: 威廉·麦金莱总统被刺杀身亡后，时任副总统的西奥多·罗斯福继任成为美国总统。
description.en: After President William McKinley was assassinated, Vice President Theodore Roosevelt succeeded him to become the President of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 里昂·乔戈什刺杀了时任美国总统威廉·麦金莱。
description.en: Leon Czolgosz assassinated the incumbent U.S. President William McKinley.

description.zh-cn: 在威廉·麦金莱的总统任期内担任副总统。
description.en: Served as Vice President during William McKinley's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福成功调停了日俄战争，促使双方签署《朴次茅斯和约》，结束了战争。
description.en: Theodore Roosevelt successfully mediated the Russo-Japanese War, leading to the signing of the Treaty of Portsmouth, which ended the war.

description.zh-cn: 因成功调停日俄战争，西奥多·罗斯福获得1906年的诺贝尔和平奖。
description.en: For his successful mediation of the Russo-Japanese War, Theodore Roosevelt was awarded the 1906 Nobel Peace Prize.

description.zh-cn: 在总统任内竭力推动巴拿马运河的建设工程，并视其为自己最伟大的成就之一。
description.en: During his presidency, he vigorously promoted the construction of the Panama Canal, considering it one of his greatest achievements.

description.zh-cn: 1908年，罗斯福认为国防部长威廉·霍华德·塔夫脱是自己进步主义思想的衣钵传人，极力推举其成为总统候选人。
description.en: In 1908, Roosevelt strongly endorsed Secretary of War William Howard Taft as the presidential candidate, believing him to be the heir to his progressive ideology.

description.zh-cn: 1911年底，罗斯福最终与塔夫脱决裂，并在1912年总统大选中作为第三方候选人与其竞争。
description.en: At the end of 1911, Roosevelt broke with Taft and competed against him as a third-party candidate in the 1912 presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 在1912年无法获得共和党总统候选人提名后，罗斯福另起炉灶，成立了进步党以支持自己的竞选。
description.en: After failing to secure the Republican presidential nomination in 1912, Roosevelt formed the Progressive Party to support his own campaign.

description.zh-cn: 进步党的分裂了共和党选票，使得民主党候选人伍德罗·威尔逊在1912年总统选举中获胜。
description.en: The Progressive Party split the Republican vote, which enabled Democratic candidate Woodrow Wilson to win the 1912 presidential election.

relationships.target: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福是西奥多·罗斯福的远房堂弟。
description.en: Franklin Delano Roosevelt was a distant cousin of Theodore Roosevelt.

relationships.target: 爱丽丝·哈撒韦·李·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 阿尔弗雷德·马汉的海权理论强化了西奥多·罗斯福关于扩张海军力量以与欧洲列强平起平坐的信念。
description.en: Alfred Mahan's sea power theories reinforced Theodore Roosevelt's belief in expanding naval power to be on par with European powers.

description.zh-cn: 在1912年的一次竞选活动中，John Schrank向西奥多·罗斯福开枪行刺，致其重伤。
description.en: During a campaign event in 1912, John Schrank shot and seriously wounded Theodore Roosevelt in an assassination attempt.

description.zh-cn: 西奥多·罗斯福的幼子昆廷·罗斯福作为飞行员在第一次世界大战中于法国上空作战时战机被击落而阵亡。
description.en: Theodore Roosevelt's youngest son, Quentin Roosevelt, was killed in action during World War I when his plane was shot down over France while serving as a pilot.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福在年度咨文中要求国会授权减免庚子赔款中超出实际损失的部分，并将多余部分用于资助中国的教育事业。
description.en: In his annual message, Roosevelt requested congressional authorization to remit the portion of the Boxer Indemnity that exceeded actual losses and to use the surplus to fund education in China.

description.zh-cn: 美国退还的部分庚子赔款被用于开办清华留美预备学校，即清华大学的前身。
description.en: A portion of the remitted Boxer Indemnity from the United States was used to establish the Tsinghua College, the predecessor of Tsinghua University.

description.zh-cn: 在美西战争爆发后，西奥多·罗斯福辞去海军部文职，组建了美国第一志愿骑兵团。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Spanish-American War, Theodore Roosevelt resigned his civilian post in the Navy Department and formed the 1st United States Volunteer Cavalry.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福在第一次世界大战期间强烈批评伍德罗·威尔逊总统过于软弱的外交政策。
description.en: During World War I, Roosevelt strongly criticized President Woodrow Wilson's foreign policy as being too weak.
